Description: Semi circular artificial eye in stone with a black painted dot to mark the iris located on the top half of the piece. Traces of red pigments at each corner and perhaps on iris (on top of black pigment). Black outline is painted along the edge. Brown and black stains on both sides. Object is fairly complete but now consists in three fragments. The front is convex, while the base is flat. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: It is possible that artificial eyes EA 90806 and EA 90807 origianlly formed a pair. Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificial eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971) , pl. XXXIV (3rd row, 2nd from the right of fig. 1)
